description: Creates an EFS access point. An access point is an application-specific view into an EFS file system that applies an operating system user and group, and a file system path, to any file system request made through the access point. The operating system user and group override any identity information provided by the NFS client. The file system path is exposed as the access point's root directory. Applications using the access point can only access data in the application's own directory and any subdirectories. To learn more, see Mounting a file system using EFS access points. This operation requires permissions for the elasticfilesystem:CreateAccessPoint action. Access points can be tagged on creation. If tags are specified in the creation action, IAM performs additional authorization on the elasticfilesystem:TagResource action to verify if users have permissions to create tags. Therefore, you must grant explicit permissions to use the elasticfilesystem:TagResource action. For more information, see Granting permissions to tag resources during creation.

parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description: A string of up to 64 ASCII characters that Amazon EFS uses to ensure idempotent creation. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: Creates tags associated with the access point. Each tag is a key-value pair, each key must be unique. For more information, see Tagging Amazon Web Services resources in the Amazon Web Services General Reference Guide. (dict) --- A tag is a key-value pair. Allowed characters are letters, white space, and numbers that can be represented in UTF-8, and the following characters: `` + - = . _ : /``. The tag key (String). The key can't start with aws:. The value of the tag key.

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: The tag key (String). The key can't start with aws:.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: The value of the tag key.

parameters.name: FileSystemId
parameters.description: The ID of the EFS file system that the access point provides access to.

parameters.name: PosixUser
parameters.description: The operating system user and group applied to all file system requests made using the access point. The POSIX user ID used for all file system operations using this access point. The POSIX group ID used for all file system operations using this access point. SecondaryGids (list) --- Secondary POSIX group IDs used for all file system operations using this access point. (integer) ---

nested_params.name: Uid
nested_params.description: The POSIX user ID used for all file system operations using this access point.

nested_params.name: Gid
nested_params.description: The POSIX group ID used for all file system operations using this access point.

nested_params.name: SecondaryGids
nested_params.description: Secondary POSIX group IDs used for all file system operations using this access point.

parameters.name: RootDirectory
parameters.description: Specifies the directory on the EFS file system that the access point exposes as the root directory of your file system to NFS clients using the access point. The clients using the access point can only access the root directory and below. If the RootDirectory > Path specified does not exist, Amazon EFS creates it and applies the CreationInfo settings when a client connects to an access point. When specifying a RootDirectory, you must provide the Path, and the CreationInfo. Amazon EFS creates a root directory only if you have provided the CreationInfo: OwnUid, OwnGID, and permissions for the directory. If you do not provide this information, Amazon EFS does not create the root directory. If the root directory does not exist, attempts to mount using the access point will fail. Path (string) --- Specifies the path on the EFS file system to expose as the root directory to NFS clients using the access point to access the EFS file system. A path can have up to four subdirectories. If the specified path does not exist, you are required to provide the CreationInfo. CreationInfo (dict) --- (Optional) Specifies the POSIX IDs and permissions to apply to the access point's RootDirectory. If the RootDirectory > Path specified does not exist, EFS creates the root directory using the CreationInfo settings when a client connects to an access point. When specifying the CreationInfo, you must provide values for all properties. Specifies the POSIX user ID to apply to the RootDirectory. Accepts values from 0 to 2^32 (4294967295). Specifies the POSIX group ID to apply to the RootDirectory. Specifies the POSIX permissions to apply to the RootDirectory, in the format of an octal number representing the file's mode bits.

nested_params.name: Path
nested_params.description: Specifies the path on the EFS file system to expose as the root directory to NFS clients using the access point to access the EFS file system. A path can have up to four subdirectories. If the specified path does not exist, you are required to provide the CreationInfo.

nested_params.name: CreationInfo
nested_params.description: (Optional) Specifies the POSIX IDs and permissions to apply to the access point's RootDirectory. If the RootDirectory > Path specified does not exist, EFS creates the root directory using the CreationInfo settings when a client connects to an access point. When specifying the CreationInfo, you must provide values for all properties.

nested_params.name: OwnerUid
nested_params.description: Specifies the POSIX user ID to apply to the RootDirectory. Accepts values from 0 to 2^32 (4294967295).

nested_params.name: OwnerGid
nested_params.description: Specifies the POSIX group ID to apply to the RootDirectory. Accepts values from 0 to 2^32 (4294967295).

nested_params.name: Permissions
nested_params.description: Specifies the POSIX permissions to apply to the RootDirectory, in the format of an octal number representing the file's mode bits.

nested_items.name: ClientToken
nested_items.description: The opaque string specified in the request to ensure idempotent creation.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the access point. This is the value of the Name tag.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: The tags associated with the access point, presented as an array of Tag objects.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The tag key (String). The key can't start with aws:.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the tag key.

nested_items.name: AccessPointId
nested_items.description: The ID of the access point, assigned by Amazon EFS.

nested_items.name: AccessPointArn
nested_items.description: The unique Amazon Resource Name (ARN) associated with the access point.

nested_items.name: FileSystemId
nested_items.description: The ID of the EFS file system that the access point applies to.

nested_items.name: PosixUser
nested_items.description: The full POSIX identity, including the user ID, group ID, and secondary group IDs on the access point that is used for all file operations by NFS clients using the access point.

nested_items.name: Uid
nested_items.description: The POSIX user ID used for all file system operations using this access point.

nested_items.name: Gid
nested_items.description: The POSIX group ID used for all file system operations using this access point.

nested_items.name: SecondaryGids
nested_items.description: Secondary POSIX group IDs used for all file system operations using this access point.
(integer) ---

nested_items.name: RootDirectory
nested_items.description: The directory on the EFS file system that the access point exposes as the root directory to NFS clients using the access point.

nested_items.name: Path
nested_items.description: Specifies the path on the EFS file system to expose as the root directory to NFS clients using the access point to access the EFS file system. A path can have up to four subdirectories. If the specified path does not exist, you are required to provide the CreationInfo.

nested_items.name: CreationInfo
nested_items.description: (Optional) Specifies the POSIX IDs and permissions to apply to the access point's RootDirectory. If the RootDirectory > Path specified does not exist, EFS creates the root directory using the CreationInfo settings when a client connects to an access point. When specifying the CreationInfo, you must provide values for all properties.

nested_items.name: OwnerUid
nested_items.description: Specifies the POSIX user ID to apply to the RootDirectory. Accepts values from 0 to 2^32 (4294967295).

nested_items.name: OwnerGid
nested_items.description: Specifies the POSIX group ID to apply to the RootDirectory. Accepts values from 0 to 2^32 (4294967295).

nested_items.name: Permissions
nested_items.description: Specifies the POSIX permissions to apply to the RootDirectory, in the format of an octal number representing the file's mode bits.

nested_items.name: OwnerId
nested_items.description: Identifies the Amazon Web Services account that owns the access point resource.

nested_items.name: LifeCycleState
nested_items.description: Identifies the lifecycle phase of the access point.
